Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "Because I'm no one, I can listen to your tale impartially and record it. You'll probably leave this world before too long. If you die without telling anyone anything about Beatrice, your children will adorn Beatrice with whatever tale they please, writing that into their memories."
Umineko Project (UP): "Because I am no one, I can listen to your tale without bias and record it. You will probably leave this world before too long. If you die without telling anything about Beatrice, your children will adorn her with their own fanciful tales and write them into history."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Because I am no one, I can listen to your tale openly and record it. You will probably leave this world before too long. If you die without telling anything about Beatrice, your children will adorn Beatrice with whatever tale they like, and write that into their memories."
PC Japanese (JP): 「俺が、誰でもないからこそ。お前の物語を公正に聞き、残すことが出来る。お前は直にこの世を去るだろう。その時、ベアトリーチェのことを何も語らずに死んだなら、お前の子供たちは、彼らが好き勝手に考えた物語でベアトリーチェを修飾し、記録に残すだろう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「俺が、誰でもないからこそ。お前の物語を公正に聞き、残すことが出来る。お前は直にこの世を去るだろう。その時、ベアトリーチェのことを何も語らずに死んだなら、お前の子供たちは、彼らが好き勝手に考えた物語でベアトリーチェを修飾し、記録に残すだろう」
Russian (RU): "Я никто и именно поэтому могу открыто выслушать и записать вашу историю. Вы в недалёком будущем покинете этот мир. Если вы умрёте, ничего не рассказав о Беатриче, ваши дети приукрасят её любой историей, какая им понравится, и вот что останется в их воспоминаниях."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Por eu não ser ninguém, eu posso ouvir a sua história sem qualquer viés, tampouco gravá‐la. Você provavelmente deixará este mundo logo mais. Se morrer sem contar a ninguém sobre Beatrice, suas crianças vão adorná‐la com seus próprios contos fantasiosos e escrevê‐los na história."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「正因為我誰都不是。所以我可以公正地聽取你的故事，將它留至後世。你不久之後，就將離開人世吧。到那時，你若是沒說過貝阿朵莉切的任何事就死了的話，你的孩子們，可是將會以他們隨便亂想出來的故事修飾貝阿朵莉切，將之留於記錄之中的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「正因为我谁都不是。所以我可以公正地听取你的故事，将它留至后世。你不久之后，就将离开人世吧。到那时，你若是没说过贝阿朵莉切的任何事就死了的话，你的孩子们，可是将会以他们随便乱想出来的故事修饰贝阿朵莉切，将之留于记录之中的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Poiché non sono nessuno, posso ascoltare apertamente il tuo racconto e registrarlo. Probabilmente in poco tempo lascerai questo mondo. Se muori senza dire nulla su Beatrice, i tuoi figli la adorneranno con qualunque racconto sia di loro gradimento, e lo imprimeranno nella memoria."

Steam (ST): "But that is none of your business. Beatrice is mine alone. No matter what other people say, no one can defile our tale. What they say is of no consequence! No matter how Krauss and the others misconstrue it, it will be neither painful nor vexing to me."

Russian (RU): "Но тебя это не касается. Беатриче только моя. Кто бы что ни говорил, никому не осквернить меня и эту историю. Их слова не имеют значения! Как бы Краусс и другие ни искажали её, меня это не заденет и не ранит."

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ma questi non sono affari tuoi. Beatrice appartiene soltanto a me. Qualunque cosa gli altri dicano, nessuno può contaminare me o quel racconto. Ciò che dicono non ha importanza! Per quanto Krauss e gli altri fraintendano, per me non sarà doloroso o irritante."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "Your daughter grew to be beautiful, and nearly identical to her mother. You must've been ecstatic. However, I doubt you'd be completely satisfied by that alone. ...After all, though she was Beatrice reborn to you, she didn't think of herself that way."
Umineko Project (UP): "Your daughter grew to be beautiful and nearly identical to her mother. You must have been ecstatic. However, it's doubtful that you were fully satisfied by this. ......After all, though she was Beatrice reborn to you, she didn't feel that way herself."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Your daughter grew to be beautiful, and nearly identical to her mother. You must have been ecstatic. However, it's doubtful that you were fully satisfied by this. ......After all, though she was Beatrice reborn to you, she didn't feel that way herself."
PC Japanese (JP): 「娘は美しく育ち、生き写しになった。お前は狂喜したろうな。だが、それでお前が全て満たされていたかは怪しい。……なぜなら、お前にとってベアトリーチェは生まれ変わりであっても。当の本人にとっては、そうではなかったからだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「娘は美しく育ち、生き写しになった。お前は狂喜したろうな。だが、それでお前が全て満たされていたかは怪しい。……なぜなら、お前にとってベアトリーチェは生まれ変わりであっても。当の本人にとっては、そうではなかったからだ」
Russian (RU): "Ваша дочь выросла в прекрасную девушку и стала почти точной копией матери. Наверное, вы были в восторге. Но вряд ли вас всё устроило. ......В конце концов, хотя для вас она была перевоплощением Беатриче, сама она так не думала."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sua filha cresceu para ser linda e praticamente idêntica a mãe. Você deve ter ficado extasiado. Mas é dúbio se realmente ficou satisfeito com isso. ......Afinal, embora Beatrice tivesse renascido para você, ela não se sentia da mesma forma."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「女儿越长越漂亮，长得跟母亲一模一样。你那时是欣喜若狂了吧。但若要问“你是否就此心满意足”，那就很难说了。……毕竟，虽然对你来说，她是贝阿朵莉切的转生。但对她本人来说，可并非如此。」

Speaker: Willard H. Wright

However, she did have that feeling. That must mean she was aware that the name Beatrice wasn't hers."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「本人は、自分がベアトリーチェと呼ばれることに違和感を拭えずにいた。……人は、生まれながらに与えられた自分の名前に違和感を覚えることはない。だが彼女は覚えた。それは、ベアトリーチェという名が自分のものではないことを、彼女が自覚していたに他ならない」
Russian (RU): "Всякий раз, когда её называли Беатриче, ей было неуютно — казалось, что что‐то не к месту. ......Люди никогда не чувствуют ничего странного в имени, которое им было дано в момент рождения. Однако у неё было такое чувство. А значит, она понимала, что имя 'Беатриче' не её."

Tuttavia, lei lo sentiva. Ciò deve voler dire che era cosciente che il nome Beatrice non le appartenesse."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "There's no need to be surprised. If you line up the information in all the games so far, this is the obvious answer you get. ...The high-level {f:5:Beatrice} talked about this. By metaphor, she said that Kinzo refused to let the witch's soul escape even after death, and instead caught it and locked it up in a body of flesh. She also said that her power and memory had been sealed. If you match that interpretation of hers to this theory, it all makes sense."
Umineko Project (UP): "There's no need to be surprised. If you line up the information in all the games so far, this is the answer it leads you to. ......The {f:5:Beatrice} on the higher plane talked about this in metaphor, saying that Kinzo refused to let the witch's soul escape even after death, and instead caught it and locked it up in a body of flesh. She also said that her power and memory had been sealed. If you match that interpretation of hers to this theory, it all makes sense."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "There's no need to be surprised. If you line up the information in all the games so far, this is the answer it leads you to. ......The high-level Beatrice talked about this. By metaphor, she said that Kinzo refused to let the witch's soul escape even after death, and instead caught it and locked it up in a body of flesh. She also said that her power and memory had been sealed. If you match that interpretation of hers to this theory, it all makes sense."
PC Japanese (JP): 「驚くことじゃねェ。これまでのゲームの情報を並べりゃ導かれる、そのままの答えだ。……上層のベアトリーチェはそれを指して、死んで逃れた魔女の魂を逃がさず、肉の体に捕らえて閉じ込めたと。そして記憶も力も封じられていると例えた。その解釈も、この推理なら筋が通る。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「驚くことじゃねェ。これまでのゲームの情報を並べりゃ導かれる、そのままの答えだ。……上層のベアトリーチェはそれを指して、死んで逃れた魔女の魂を逃がさず、肉の体に捕らえて閉じ込めたと。そして記憶も力も封じられていると例えた。その解釈も、この推理なら筋が通る」
Russian (RU): "Ничего удивительного. Информация из всех предыдущих игр приводит как раз к такому ответу. ......Высшая {f:5:Беатриче} метафорой сказала, что Кинзо не отпустил душу ведьмы даже после смерти и вместо этого поймал её и запер в теле из плоти. Также она сказала, что были запечатаны её сила и память. Если соотнести её толкование с этой теорией, оно приобретает смысл."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não há por que se surpreender. Se reunir as informações de todos os jogos até agora, esta é a resposta que você chegaria. ......A {f:5:Beatrice} no plano superior falou sobre isso com uma metáfora, dizendo que Kinzo se recusou a deixar sua alma escapar, mesmo após sua morte, e a capturou e prendeu em uma gaiola de carne. Ela também disse que seus poderes e memórias haviam sido selados. Se você juntar a interpretação dela com essa teoria, tudo faz sentido."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「沒什麼好吃驚的。也就只是列舉下之前遊戲中所得的情報，就可以導出的，明擺著的答案。……上層的貝阿朵莉切將此比喻成了，不肯放跑以死來逃脫的魔女的靈魂，你用血肉牢籠捉住、封住了她。並且，她的記憶與力量也被封住了。這個解釋，也能以此推理說通。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「没什么好吃惊的。也就只是列举下之前游戏中所得的情报，就可以导出的，明摆着的答案。……上层的贝阿朵莉切将此比喻成了，不肯放跑以死来逃脱的魔女的灵魂，你用血肉牢笼捉住、封住了她。并且，她的记忆与力量也被封住了。这个解释，也能以此推理说通。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non ha senso essere stupiti. Se si mettono in fila le informazioni di tutti i giochi fatti finora, questa è la risposta a cui essi ti guidano. ... La Beatrice di un livello superiore ne parlò. Tramite una metafora, disse che Kinzo si rifiutò di lasciar scappare la sua anima persino dopo la sua morte, e così la catturò e la rinchiuse in una gabbia di carne. Disse anche che il suo potere e i suoi ricordi erano sigillati. Se si fa corrispondere quella sua interpretazione con questa teoria, tutto ha un senso."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright

And I don't intend to doubt the depths of Kinzo's love for this woman called Beatrice. ......How a man shows his affection for a child who is the only living reminder of her mother is no one's business. If she grew to look more and more like Beatrice, and Kinzo's love gave rise to a new, special emotion, I find that a very human reaction."
PC Japanese (JP): 「コウノトリを否定はしねェ。そして金蔵がどれだけ、ベアトリーチェという女を深く愛していたかも、疑う気はねェ。………忘れ形見にどういう愛情を注ぐかは人の勝手だ。育つほどに似ていくその姿に、金蔵が愛ゆえに特別な感情を持ったとしても、俺はそれを人間らしい感情だと思うぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「コウノトリを否定はしねェ。そして金蔵がどれだけ、ベアトリーチェという女を深く愛していたかも、疑う気はねェ。………忘れ形見にどういう愛情を注ぐかは人の勝手だ。育つほどに似ていくその姿に、金蔵が愛ゆえに特別な感情を持ったとしても、俺はそれを人間らしい感情だと思うぜ」

Если она всё больше напоминала Беатриче, и любовь Кинзо породила новую, особую эмоцию, это вполне нормальная реакция."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não irei contrariar a cegonha. Se ela cresceu cada vez mais parecida com a Beatrice, e o amor de Kinzo deu vida a uma nova emoção especial, eu acredito que seja uma reação muito humana."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我不否定這送子鸛。並且我也毫不懷疑，金藏是有多麼地深愛著，名叫貝阿朵莉切的女人。………對所愛之人的遺孤注入多少愛，是此人的自由。即便看著越是長大就越像的她的外貌，金藏因愛而有了特殊的感情，我認為，這個也是人之常情。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我不否定这送子鹳。并且我也毫不怀疑，金藏是有多么地深爱着，名叫贝阿朵莉切的女人。………对所爱之人的遗孤注入多少爱，是此人的自由。即便看着越是长大就越像的她的外貌，金藏因爱而有了特殊的感情，我认为，这个也是人之常情。」

Se cominciò ad assomigliare sempre più a Beatrice, e l'amore di Kinzo ha dato vita ad una nuova, speciale emozione, la trovo una reazione molto umana."

Speaker: Kumasawa Chiyo
Steam (ST): "The Master stayed in Kuwadorian as much as time allowed. He would sometimes pretend to go on a business trip and stay there for several days, treasuring the time he spent with Beatrice-sama. ...It was not a father-daughter relationship. You could sometimes catch a glimpse of his great love for the dead Beatrice-sama, and it was a heart-warming thing."
Umineko Project (UP): "The Master stayed in Kuwadorian as much as time allowed. He would sometimes pretend to go on a business trip and stay there for several days, treasuring the time he spent with Beatrice‐sama. ......It was not simply a father‐daughter relationship. You could sometimes catch a glimpse of his great love for the late Beatrice‐sama, and it was a heart‐warming thing."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The Master stayed in Kuwadorian as much as time allowed. He would sometimes pretend to go on a business trip and stay there for several days, treasuring the time he spent with Beatrice-sama. ......It was not simply a father-daughter relationship. You could sometimes catch a glimpse of his great love for the dead Beatrice-sama, and it was a heart-warming thing."
PC Japanese (JP): 「お館様は、お時間の許す限り、九羽鳥庵へ通われました。時にはご出張と偽られ、何日も滞在され、ベアトリーチェさまとの生活を大切になさいました。……それは親子としての関係だけでなく。亡きベアトリーチェさまへの深い愛を垣間見れる、心温まるものでございましたとも。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お館様は、お時間の許す限り、九羽鳥庵へ通われました。時にはご出張と偽られ、何日も滞在され、ベアトリーチェさまとの生活を大切になさいました。……それは親子としての関係だけでなく。亡きベアトリーチェさまへの深い愛を垣間見れる、心温まるものでございましたとも」
Russian (RU): "Господин оставался в Кувадориане сколько позволяло время. Иногда он притворялся, что уезжал по делам, и оставался там на несколько дней, дорожа временем, которое проводил с госпожой Беатриче. ......Это были не просто отношения отца и дочери. Порой можно было мельком разглядеть его сильную, трогательную любовь к покойной госпоже Беатриче."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O Mestre permaneceu em Kuwadorian o quanto o tempo lhe permitiu. Às vezes, ele fingia que ia sair em uma viagem de negócios e ficava diversos dias lá, valorizando o tempo que passava junto da Beatrice‐sama. ......Não era uma simples relação entre pai e filha. De vez em quando, era possível perceber relances de seu grande amor pela Beatrice‐sama posterior, e isso era algo muito caloroso."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「老爺只要有時間，就會去九羽鳥庵。有時候，還會假稱出差，逗留個好幾天，非常珍惜與貝阿朵莉切小姐共度的生活。……這並非，僅僅是作為父女。而是一副，可以窺視到老爺對已故貝阿朵莉切夫人的深深的愛的，暖人心脾的情景。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「老爷只要有时间，就会去九羽鸟庵。有时候，还会假称出差，逗留个好几天，非常珍惜与贝阿朵莉切小姐共度的生活。……这并非，仅仅是作为父女。而是一副，可以窥视到老爷对已故贝阿朵莉切夫人的深深的爱的，暖人心脾的情景。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Il Padrone rimaneva in Kuwadorian per tutto il tempo che gli era concesso. Talvolta faceva finta di partire per un viaggio d'affari e rimaneva lì per diversi giorni, facendo tesoro del tempo che spendeva assieme a Beatrice-sama. {n}Non era una semplice relazione padre-figlia. Ogni tanto si poteva intravedere il suo grande amore per la defunta Beatrice-sama, ed era qualcosa di confortante."

Speaker: Kumasawa Chiyo

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………この私が、自らの口より真実を話せる内に、この機会を設けてくれたことを感謝する。……お前はきっと、ベアトリーチェより遣わされた、天の使いに違いない…。……感謝する………」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Fuhahahahahahahaha... Ridiculous. ...Those greedy elders kept looking out for their own personal interests and couldn't decide on a new Head at all. It was as foolish as arguing about who the new captain should be on a sinking ship."
Umineko Project (UP): "Fuhahahahahahahaha...... Ridiculous. ......Those greedy elders were so intent on looking out for their own personal interests that they couldn't even decide on a new head. They were like fools arguing about who the new captain should be on a sinking ship."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Fuhahahahahahahaha...... Ridiculous. ......Those greedy elders kept looking out for their own personal interests and couldn't decide on a new head at all. It was as foolish as arguing about who the new captain should be on a sinking ship."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ふ、はっははははははは……。とんでもない。……欲深な長老たちは、互いの利益ばかりを主張し合い、新しい当主を選び出すことさえ出来なかったのだ。まるで、沈み行く船で、新しき船長は誰かと議論するような愚かさよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ふ、はっははははははは……。とんでもない。……欲深な長老たちは、互いの利益ばかりを主張し合い、新しい当主を選び出すことさえ出来なかったのだ。まるで、沈み行く船で、新しき船長は誰かと議論するような愚かさよ」
Russian (RU): "Фу‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха...... Глупости. ......Жадные старейшины думали лишь о собственных интересах и никак не могли решиться на выбор нового главы. Так же глупо, как спорить о том, кому стать новым капитаном на тонущем корабле."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Fuhahahahahahahaha...... Ridículo. ......Aqueles velhos gananciosos estavam tão dispostos a buscar por seus próprios interesses pessoais que sequer podiam decidir o novo chefe. Eram como idiotas discutindo sobre quem seria o novo capitão enquanto o barco afundava."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哼，哈、哈哈哈哈哈哈哈……。哪裡的話。……貪婪的長老們，一心只想著自己的利益，連選出新當主都做不到。蠢得簡直就像是，坐在一個勁往下沉的船上，爭論由誰當新船長。」

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Fuhahahahahahahaha... ridicolo. ... Quegli avidi vecchi continuavano a badare ai propri interessi e non riuscivano a decidere chi dovesse essere il nuovo capo. Era tanto folle quanto discutere su chi debba essere il nuovo capitano di una nave che affonda."

Umineko Project (UP): "It's all because of my toes. If only I'd had one fewer toe on each foot, my life may have turned out quite differently......"

Steam (ST): In the Ushiromiya family, polydactyly was seen as a mark of good fortune. After all, many of the great ones in their family history had possessed it.
Umineko Project (UP): In the Ushiromiya family, polydactyly was seen as a sign of good fortune.{n}This was because it was a common factor among many of the greats in the family's history.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the Ushiromiya family, polydactyly was seen as a sign of good fortune. This was because many of the great ones in the family history had had it.
PC Japanese (JP): 右代宮家では、多指症は吉兆の徴と尊ばれていた。歴代の名君に多指症が多かったためだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 右代宮家では、多指症は吉兆の徴と尊ばれていた。{n}歴代の名君に多指症が多かったためだ。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "It was all very pathetic. The elders didn't care whom they dragged in as long as it wouldn't benefit any one of them particularly."
Umineko Project (UP): "It was all very pathetic. The elders didn't care whom they dragged in as long as it wouldn't favor any of them over the others."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It was all very pathetic. The elders didn't care whom they dragged in as long as it wouldn't benefit any one of them particularly."
PC Japanese (JP): 「下らぬ話よ。長老どもは、自分たちの誰も得をしない馬の骨であれば、誰でも良かったのだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「下らぬ話よ。長老どもは、自分たちの誰も得をしない馬の骨であれば、誰でも良かったのだ」
Russian (RU): "Какое убожество. Старейшинам было всё равно, кого втянуть, лишь бы он не приносил пользу одному из них в частности."

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Era tutto davvero patetico. Agli anziani non interessava chi dovessero tirare in ballo, finché ciò non avrebbe giovato ad uno di loro in particolare."

Steam (ST): "So, they just happened to hear that someone in one of the branch families had six toes, and decided that would do well enough."
Umineko Project (UP): "So, they just happened to hear that someone in one of the branch families had six toes, and decided that would do well enough."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Precisely. The elders didn't care what sort of novice became the next Head, as long as they could make him their puppet. In fact, the more this person was ignorant of leadership, the better it would be for them."
Umineko Project (UP): "Precisely. The elders didn't care what sort of novice became the head, as long as they could make him their puppet. In fact, the more ignorant this person was of how to lead, the better it would be for them."

PC Japanese (JP): 「そういうことだ。長老どもは、自分たちの操り人形になるなら、次期当主など、どこの青二才でも良かったのだ。むしろ、帝王学に無知な人間ほど好ましい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そういうことだ。長老どもは、自分たちの操り人形になるなら、次期当主など、どこの青二才でも良かったのだ。むしろ、帝王学に無知な人間ほど好ましい」
Russian (RU): "Именно. Старейшин не волновало, какой новичок станет главой, пока они могли сделать его своей марионеткой. На самом деле, чем хуже этот человек умел руководить, тем для них было лучше."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Exatamente. Eles não se importavam com que tipo de amador se tornaria o chefe, desde que pudessem transformá‐lo em uma marionete. Na verdade, quanto mais ignorante a pessoa designada fosse, melhor seria para eles."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「就是這麼回事。對長老們來說，只要能成為他們的提線木偶，下任當主什麼的，不論哪來的小兒郎都無所謂。不如說，越是對帝王學無知的人，就越是能令他們滿意。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「就是这么回事。对长老们来说，只要能成为他们的提线木偶，下任当主什么的，不论哪来的小儿郎都无所谓。不如说，越是对帝王学无知的人，就越是能令他们满意。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Precisamente. Agli anziani non importava quale novizio diventasse il capo, finché riuscivano ad utilizzarlo come loro marionetta. In effetti, più questa persona non sapeva come comandare, meglio sarebbe stato per loro."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "...Grandfather..."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Grandfather......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Grandfather..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……お祖父さま……。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Lion, it is quite different in your case. ...You will be the one who inherits everything I have. That is the fate you were granted on the day of your birth. That is why I gave you that silver ring and raised you so strictly. ...You are quite different from me. You are already a splendid Successor, of whom no one could be ashamed..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Lion. It is quite different in your case. ......You will be the one who inherits everything I have. That is the fate you were granted on the day of your birth. That is why I gave you that silver ring and raised you so strictly. ......You are quite different from me. You are already a splendid successor, of whom no one could be ashamed......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「理御。お前は違う。……お前は、我が全てを受け継ぐ者だ。お前が生を受けた日よりそれは運命付けられていた。だからこそお前に銀の指輪を与え、厳しく育ててきた。……そなたは私とは違う。誰にも恥じることのない、立派な当主跡継ぎであるぞ……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「理御。お前は違う。……お前は、我が全てを受け継ぐ者だ。お前が生を受けた日よりそれは運命付けられていた。だからこそお前に銀の指輪を与え、厳しく育ててきた。……そなたは私とは違う。誰にも恥じることのない、立派な当主跡継ぎであるぞ……」
Russian (RU): "Лион. Твой случай не такой. ......Ты унаследуешь всё, что у меня есть. Такова твоя судьба со дня твоего рождения. Именно поэтому я дал тебе серебряное кольцо и так строго тебя воспитывал. ......Ты отличаешься от меня. Ты уже идеально подходишь на роль главы, и никому бы не стало за тебя стыдно......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Lion. Seu caso é bem diferente. ......Você herdará tudo o que eu tenho. Este é o destino concedido a você no dia de seu nascimento. É por isso que dei a você este anel de prata e lhe criei com muito rigor. ......Você é bem diferente de mim. Para quem me sucederá, você já alcançou o esplendor — alguém a qual não me envergonharei......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「理御。你可並非如此。……你是繼承我一切的人。你從獲得生命時起，就有了這個命運。正因如此，所以我才把銀戒指給了你，嚴格培養。……你與我不同。你是個無愧於任何人的，了不起的當主繼承人……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「理御。你可并非如此。……你是继承我一切的人。你从获得生命时起，就有了这个命运。正因如此，所以我才把银戒指给了你，严格培养。……你与我不同。你是个无愧于任何人的，了不起的当主继承人……」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Lion. Nel tuo caso è diverso. ... Tu sarai la persona che erediterà tutto ciò in mio possesso. Questo è il fato che ti è stato donato nel giorno della tua nascita. {n}Per questo ti ho fatto dono di quell'anello argenteo e ti ho educato in modo così severo. ... Sei piuttosto differente da me. Sei già uno splendido successore, di cui nessuno si vergognerebbe..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "...Y-Yes sir..."

Umineko Project (UP): "A puppet heir, huh... ...I doubt that could've been easy."

Steam (ST): As he pondered about where to begin, Kinzo laughed bitterly.
Umineko Project (UP): As he pondered about where to begin, Kinzo laughed bitterly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は、何から語れば良いかと思案するように、苦々しく笑う。
Russian (RU): Размышляя, откуда бы начать, Кинзо горько засмеялся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como se ponderasse por onde começar, Kinzo riu discretamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏如在思索著“該從哪說起好”般，咧嘴苦笑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏如在思索着“该从哪说起好”般，咧嘴苦笑。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Pensando a come iniziare, Kinzo rise amaramente.

Steam (ST): It would probably bring back painful memories no matter where he started from...
Umineko Project (UP): It would probably bring back nothing but painful memories no matter where he started from...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It would probably bring back painful memories no matter where he started from...
PC Japanese (JP): 何から語っても、辛い思い出しか蘇らないのだろう…。
Russian (RU): Наверное, мучительные воспоминания вернутся откуда бы он ни начал...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso provavelmente não traria nada além de dolorosas memórias, independente de onde ele começasse...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不論從哪說起，都只能勾起辛酸的回憶吧…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不论从哪说起，都只能勾起辛酸的回忆吧…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Probabilmente avrebbe riportato alla memoria ricordi dolorosi, da qualunque punto iniziasse...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "It...lasted for so long, that span of gray days. That dizzying stretch of time I spent dead, like moss growing on a rock..."
Umineko Project (UP): "It......lasted for so long, that span of gray days. That mind‐numbing stretch of time I spent dead passed like moss growing on a rock......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It......lasted for so long, that span of gray days. That dizzying stretch of time I spent dead, like moss growing on a rock......"
PC Japanese (JP): 「あれは、……あまりに長い長い、灰色の日々であった。それは私には、岩に生す苔のような、気の遠くなるほど長い長い、死んだ時間……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あれは、……あまりに長い長い、灰色の日々であった。それは私には、岩に生す苔のような、気の遠くなるほど長い長い、死んだ時間……」
Russian (RU): "Это были...... очень долгие и серые дни. Я провёл тот головокружительный период времени мёртвым, как мох, растущий на скале......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Aqueles foram......dias cinzentos muito longos. Aquele período de tempo entorpecente em que passei morto como um musgo crescendo em uma rocha......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那是段，……實在太長太長了的，灰色的日子。對我來說，這段日子是如岩石長出青苔般，漫長到令人髮指的，行屍走肉般的時光……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那是段，……实在太长太长了的，灰色的日子。对我来说，这段日子是如岩石长出青苔般，漫长到令人发指的，行尸走肉般的时光……」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Esso... durò così tanto, quel periodo di giorni grigi. Quel vertiginoso periodo di tempo che passai da morto, come muschio che cresce sulle rocce..."

Steam (ST): I became the rope in the tug of war between the elders, who thought of nothing but their own profit, ...and I probably could have snapped at any moment.
Umineko Project (UP): I became the rope in the tug of war between the elders, who thought of nothing but their own profit, .....and I probably could have snapped at any moment.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 己の利益しか考えぬ長老たちの綱引きの綱にされ、……私はいつ引き千切れても、おかしくなかった。
Russian (RU): Я стал верёвкой в перетягивании каната между старейшинами, думающими только о своей выгоде...... и меня могли разорвать в любой момент.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu me tornei a corda do cabo de guerra deles, que não pensavam em nada além dos próprios lucros, .....e poderia ter rompido a qualquer momento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 被只考慮自身利益的長老們當成了拔河比賽的那根繩子，……我不論何時被扯斷都不足為奇。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 被只考虑自身利益的长老们当成了拔河比赛的那根绳子，……我不论何时被扯断都不足为奇。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Diventai la corda tirata dalla guerra tra gli anziani, che non pensavano ad altro che al proprio interesse... e probabilmente avrei perso il controllo in qualunque momento.

Steam (ST): However, people are far more resilient than one would think.
Umineko Project (UP): However, people are far more resilient than one would think.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, people are far more resilient than one would think.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、人は呆れるくらいに頑丈だった。
Russian (RU): Но люди гораздо крепче, чем кажется.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas as pessoas são mais resilientes do que muitos imaginam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，人這玩意卻驚人的結實。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，人这玩意却惊人的结实。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, le persone sono di gran lunga più determinate di quanto si possa pensare.

Steam (ST): Though I spent so many days as though I had been killed, ...I was not killed.
Umineko Project (UP): Though I spent so many days like a dead man, ......I was not killed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Though I spent so many days as though I had been killed, ......I was not killed.
PC Japanese (JP): あの殺されたような長き日々であっても、……私は殺されなかったのだ。
Russian (RU): Пусть даже я провёл столько дней так, будто меня убили...... я не был убит.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Embora eu tenha passado tantos dias como um homem morto, ......eu não fui morto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 縱然是過著恰似被殺了般的漫長的日子，……但我還是並沒有真的被殺死。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纵然是过着恰似被杀了般的漫长的日子，……但我还是并没有真的被杀死。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sebbene passai così tanti giorni come se fossi stato ucciso... in realtà non lo ero.

Steam (ST): So, I was forced to search for death on my own...
Umineko Project (UP): So, I would have to search for death on my own......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, I was forced to search for death on my own......
PC Japanese (JP): だから私は、死に場所を、求めなければならなかった……。
Russian (RU): Поэтому мне пришлось искать смерть самому......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, eu tive que ir em busca da minha própria morte......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，我必須去自行尋求一個，葬身之所……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，我必须去自行寻求一个，葬身之所……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò, fui costretto a cercare la morte a modo mio...

Steam (ST): Before I realized it, I had reached an age at which the young would laugh at me if I tried to call myself young.
Umineko Project (UP): The next thing I knew, I had reached the age when I could no longer refer to myself as "young" without drawing laughter from those who were.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Before I realized it, I reached an age at which the young would laugh at me if I tried to call myself young.
PC Japanese (JP): 気付けばもう、自らを若者と呼べば、若者たちに笑われそうになる歳になっていた。
Russian (RU): Не успел я осознать, как достиг того возраста, когда молодёжь засмеялась бы надо мной, назови я себя молодым.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando dei por mim, eu já havia atingido a idade em que não poderia mais me considerar "jovem" sem rir daqueles que eram.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 等意識到時，自己已經到了，自稱年輕人，就有可能被年輕人們笑話的歲數了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 等意识到时，自己已经到了，自称年轻人，就有可能被年轻人们笑话的岁数了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Prima di accorgermene, raggiunsi un'età in cui i giovani avrebbero riso di me se avessi provato a definirmi tale.

Steam (ST): That dizzyingly long stretch of gray was left completely empty.
Umineko Project (UP): They were long, dreary, gray days without any substance.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That dizzyingly long stretch of gray was left completely empty.
PC Japanese (JP): 気が遠くなるような、長くても何も中身のない灰色の日々。
Russian (RU): Эта головокружительная полоса серых дней была совершенно пустой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aqueles foram longos e aborrecidos dias cinzentos insubstanciais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那段簡直令人犯暈的，雖漫長卻全無內容的灰色歲月。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那段简直令人犯晕的，虽漫长却全无内容的灰色岁月。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quel periodo vertiginosamente lungo di giorni grigi venne lasciato completamente vuoto.

Steam (ST): It lasted for a full 20 years.
Umineko Project (UP): And they lasted for a full twenty years.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It lasted for a full 20 years.
PC Japanese (JP): それは２０年にも及んだ。
Russian (RU): Она продолжалась целых 20 лет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E eles duraram por vinte anos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 竟已有了，20 年。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Durò 20 lunghi anni.

Steam (ST): In 20 years, a person can be born, find a purpose, and even become their own man with their own place in the world.
Umineko Project (UP): In twenty years, a person can be born, find a purpose, and even become their own man with their own place in the world.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In 20 years, a person can be born, find a purpose, and even become their own man with their own place in the world.
PC Japanese (JP): ２０年あれば、人は生まれ、志を持ち、社会へ飛び出すことさえ出来る。
Russian (RU): За 20 лет человек может родиться, обрести цель и даже найти своё место в мире.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em vinte anos, uma pessoa pode nascer, encontrar um propósito e se tornar dona de si, tendo seu próprio lugar no mundo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 若有 20 年，一個人能出生、立志，甚至還能闖入社會。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 若有 20 年，一个人能出生、立志，甚至还能闯入社会。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In 20 anni, una persona può nascere, trovare il proprio scopo, e diventare persino un uomo con il proprio posto nel mondo.

Steam (ST): In short, ...if one truly becomes a human only when they have become a working adult...
Umineko Project (UP): In short, .....if one truly becomes a human only when they have become a working adult...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In short, .....if one truly becomes a human only when they have become a working adult...
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、……社会人となって初めて人間と呼べるのだとしたら。
Russian (RU): В общем..... если становишься человеком только становясь работоспособным взрослым...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Encurtando, .....se uma pessoa se torna humana apenas após se tornar um trabalhador adulto...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，……如果從踏入社會的那一刻起，才首次可以稱之為人的話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，……如果从踏入社会的那一刻起，才首次可以称之为人的话。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In poche parole... se si diventa veramente umani solo quando si diventa adulti e si lavora...

Steam (ST): Then I spent a period of time long enough to create a human... doing nothing but playing the part of those greedy elders' puppet.
Umineko Project (UP): ...then I spent an amount of time long enough to create a human......doing nothing except playing the part of puppet to those greedy old men.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then I spent a time long enough to create a human......by doing nothing except playing the part of those greedy elders' puppet.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は、人間が一人、生み出せるほどの膨大な時間を、……何もすることなく、欲深な老人たちの人形として過ごしてきたわけだ。
Russian (RU): Я играл марионетку тех жадных старейшин так долго, что за это время можно было создать человека.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...então eu passei tempo o suficiente para se criar um humano......fazendo nada além de encenar o papel de marionete daqueles velhos gananciosos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那麼我就是，什麼都沒做，作為貪婪老人們的人偶地虛度了，……長到能創造出一個人的龐大時間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那么我就是，什么都没做，作为贪婪老人们的人偶地虚度了，……长到能创造出一个人的庞大时间。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Allora, passai un tempo abbastanza lungo da creare un umano... senza fare nient'altro che la parte del burattino di quegli avidi anziani.

Steam (ST): Ironically, though that time aged my body, it did not age my mind.
Umineko Project (UP): Ironically, though that time aged my body, it did not age my mind.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ironically, though that time aged my body, it did not age my mind.
PC Japanese (JP): そんな日々は、体を老いさせても、皮肉にも、心は老いさせない。
Russian (RU): Как ни странно, тогда взрослело моё тело, но не ум.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ironicamente, embora o tempo tenha envelhecido meu corpo, ele não afetou minha idade mental.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這段歲月，雖令身體變老了，但諷刺的是，它並沒有令心也一起變老。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这段岁月，虽令身体变老了，但讽刺的是，它并没有令心也一起变老。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ironicamente, quel periodo invecchiò il mio corpo, ma non la mia mente.

Steam (ST): My mind alone... was still as young as it had been during those rich, happy days before I was summoned to Odawara.
Umineko Project (UP): In my heart, I was still young, and I looked back fondly on the fulfilling days before I was summoned to Odawara.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): My mind alone... was still as young as it had been during those rich, happy days before I had been summoned to Odawara.
PC Japanese (JP): 心だけは、小田原に呼び出される直前の、……あの充実した日々を懐かしむ、若いまま。
Russian (RU): Один только мой ум... был всё так же молод, как в те богатые, счастливые дни до того, как меня вызвали в Одавару.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No meu coração, eu ainda era jovem e olhava com carinho para trás, para aqueles dias realizados antes de eu ser convocado para Odawara.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 唯獨心，依舊在眷戀著，被叫來小田原之前的，……那段充實的歲月，依舊年輕。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 唯独心，依旧在眷恋着，被叫来小田原之前的，……那段充实的岁月，依旧年轻。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La mia mente soltanto... era giovane come durante quei ricchi giorni felici prima che mi convocassero a Odawara.

Steam (ST): And yet, my body alone grew older and older. Eventually, the vast gap between the two reached almost incomprehensible levels.
Umineko Project (UP): Only my body continued to age, and at some point, the gulf between the two had widened to the point that it was hard to comprehend.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And yet, my body alone had grown older and older. Eventually, the vast gap between the two grew to almost incomprehensible levels.
PC Japanese (JP): なのに体だけは老いを重ね、いつしか、その乖離は理解し難いほどにまで広がった。
Russian (RU): Только моё тело становилось всё старше, и в конце концов огромная разница между ними поднялась почти до невообразимых высот.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apenas o meu corpo continuou a envelhecer e, em determinado momento, essa divergência entre corpo e mente se expandiu ao ponto de se tornar de difícil compreensão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，身體越來越老，在不知不覺中，這份身心的差距，大到了令人難以理解的地步。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，身体越来越老，在不知不觉中，这份身心的差距，大到了令人难以理解的地步。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, solo il mio corpo, era diventato sempre più vecchio. Alla fine, quella grande distanza tra i due, raggiunse livelli pressoché incomprensibili.

Steam (ST): So, I could hardly believe that the worn-out man in the mirror was really me.
Umineko Project (UP): So, I could hardly believe that the worn‐out man in the mirror was really me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, I could hardly believe that the worn out man in the mirror was really me.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、鏡に映る、疲れ切った男が、とても自分と思えない。
Russian (RU): Поэтому мне с трудом верилось, что измотанный человек в зеркале действительно я.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, eu mal conseguia acreditar que o homem desgastado que eu via no espelho era realmente eu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，看著鏡子中疲憊不堪的男子，怎麼都不覺得是自己。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，看着镜子中疲惫不堪的男子，怎么都不觉得是自己。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò, non riuscivo quasi a credere che quell'uomo consumato nello specchio fossi davvero io.

Steam (ST): No, it really wasn't me.
Umineko Project (UP): No, it really wasn't me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No, it really wasn't me.
PC Japanese (JP): いや、本当に自分ではないのだ。
Russian (RU): Нет, это и вправду был не я.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não, não era realmente eu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不，這真的不是自己。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不，这真的不是自己。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): No, in realtà non ero io.

Steam (ST): The "Head of the Ushiromiya family" was just a name.
Umineko Project (UP): I was the "head of the Ushiromiya family" in name only.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The 'Head of the Ushiromiya family' was just a name.
PC Japanese (JP): 右代宮家当主などとは、名ばかり。
Russian (RU): 'Глава семьи Уширомия' просто название.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era o "chefe da família Ushiromiya", apenas no nome.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 右代宮家當主什麼的，僅僅是個名頭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 右代宫家当主什么的，仅仅是个名头。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il ‘Capo della famiglia Ushiromiya’ era solo un nome.

Steam (ST): It had no power. It didn't require that I have any independence. There was no need for me to get involved with anything.
Umineko Project (UP): I had no rights, no autonomy. There was no need for me to do anything other than what was asked of me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It had no power. It didn't require that I have any independence. There was no need for me to get involved with anything.
PC Japanese (JP): 何の権限もない。自主性も必要ない。余計なことをする必要もない。
Russian (RU): В нём нет никакой власти. Для него не нужно быть независимым. Мне было незачем в чём‐либо участвовать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não tinha direitos, não tinha autonomia. Não era necessário que eu fizesse nada além daquilo que me era pedido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 沒有任何權限。不需要自主性。不需要做任何多余的事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 没有任何权限。不需要自主性。不需要做任何多余的事。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non aveva potere. Non implicava la mia indipendenza. Non avevo bisogno di essere coinvolto in nulla.

Steam (ST): I was just a doll sitting there on the doll rack, gathering dust.
Umineko Project (UP): I was just a doll sitting there on the shelf, gathering dust.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I was just a doll sitting there on the doll rack, gathering dust.
PC Japanese (JP): ひな壇に飾られたまま、埃を積もらせ、……ただただじっとしているだけの、お人形。
Russian (RU): Я был обычной куклой, пылящейся на кукольной полке.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu era apenas um boneco sentado na prateleira, acumulando poeira.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 被裝飾在人偶架上，積著灰塵，……我就只是個，一直一直、一動不動地待著的，人偶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 被装饰在人偶架上，积着灰尘，……我就只是个，一直一直、一动不动地待着的，人偶。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non ero altro che una bambola seduta su uno scaffale, prendendo polvere.

Steam (ST): I remember nothing but lazily flipping through Western books I liked, locking myself up inside my own world, ...doing nothing but playing with roses and drinking terrible drinks.
Umineko Project (UP): I remember nothing but lazily flipping through Western books I liked, locking myself in my own world, ......doing nothing but playing with roses and drinking terrible drinks.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I remember nothing but lazily flipping through Western books I liked, locking myself in my own world, ......doing nothing but playing with roses and drinking terrible drinks.
PC Japanese (JP): 私はぼんやりと、好きな洋書を漁り、自分だけの世界に閉じ篭り、……悪い酒と薔薇いじりを覚えただけ。
Russian (RU): Я помню только то, как лениво листал любимые западные книги, заперевшись в собственном мире...... возился с розами и распивал жуткие напитки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não lembro de nada além de ficar folhando os livros ocidentais que eu gostava, me trancando no meu próprio mundo, ......fazendo nada além de brincar com rosas e consumir bebidas horríveis.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那段日子，我就只是稀里糊塗地學會了，翻閱我喜歡的西洋書籍，把自己關在只屬於自己的世界裡，……耍酒瘋與修剪玫瑰。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那段日子，我就只是稀里糊涂地学会了，翻阅我喜欢的西洋书籍，把自己关在只属于自己的世界里，……耍酒疯与修剪玫瑰。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non ricordo di aver fatto nulla se non sfogliare pigramente i libri occidentali che mi piacevano, chiudermi nel mio mondo... non fare altro che giocare con le rose e bere alcolici terribili.

Steam (ST): And it lasted a full 20 years.
Umineko Project (UP): And it lasted a full twenty years.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And it lasted a full 20 years.
PC Japanese (JP): それが、２０年も。
Russian (RU): И так продолжалось целых 20 лет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E isso persistiu por vinte anos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 像這樣，一過就過了 20 年。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 像这样，一过就过了 20 年。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E durò 20 lunghi anni.

Steam (ST): Before I knew it...
Umineko Project (UP): Before I knew it...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Before I knew it...
PC Japanese (JP): 気付けば。
Russian (RU): Не успел я оглянуться...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Antes que percebesse...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 等注意到時。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 等注意到时。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Prima che me ne accorgessi...

Steam (ST): I suddenly had a wife I did not know. ...It wasn't any wife I had chosen.
Umineko Project (UP): ...I had a stranger for a wife. ......It wasn't any wife I had chosen.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I suddenly had a wife I did not know.......It wasn't any wife I had chosen.
PC Japanese (JP): いつの間にか、知らぬ妻がいた。……自分が選んだ妻ではない。
Russian (RU): У меня вдруг появилась незнакомая жена. ......Я не выбирал её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Eu já tinha uma esposa desconhecida. ......Não era uma esposa que eu tivesse escolhido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 自己已在不知不覺間，有了陌生的妻子。……她不是我自己選的妻子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 自己已在不知不觉间，有了陌生的妻子。……她不是我自己选的妻子。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ebbi improvvisamente una moglie che non conoscevo. ... Non l'avevo scelta io.

Steam (ST): It was the daughter of some noble family that the elders had chosen and forced on me for their own reasons, ...but that did not matter to me.
Umineko Project (UP): She was someone that the elders had chosen and forced on me for their own reasons, the daughter of some noble family or something, ......but that hardly mattered to me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was the daughter of some noble family that the elders had chosen and forced on me for their own reasons, ......but that did not matter to me.
PC Japanese (JP): 長老たちが、彼らの都合で選び、強いた、どこぞのやんごとなき一族の姫君らしかったが、……どうでもいい。
Russian (RU): Она была дочерью одной знатной семьи, выбранной старейшинами по их личным причинам...... но для меня это не имело значения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela era alguém que os velhos escolheram e empurraram a mim por motivos pessoais deles, a filha de alguma família nobre ou algo assim, ......mas aquilo pouco importava para mim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然她好像是，長老們為己之便所選，所強加給我的，不知哪的尊貴家族的公主，……但我根本無所謂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然她好像是，长老们为己之便所选，所强加给我的，不知哪的尊贵家族的公主，……但我根本无所谓。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era la figlia di una certa famiglia nobile che gli anziani avevano designato e che mi avevano obbligato a sposare per i loro interessi... ma ciò non mi importava.

Steam (ST): I did not love my wife, but neither did I dislike her.
Umineko Project (UP): I did not love my wife, but neither did I dislike her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I did not love my wife, but neither did I dislike her.
PC Japanese (JP): 妻を愛してなかったし、かといって毛嫌いもしなかった。
Russian (RU): Я не любил свою жену, но и не испытывал к ней неприязни.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não amava minha esposa, mas também não a odiava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我不愛妻子，不過話雖如此，我倒也並沒有對她望而生厭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我不爱妻子，不过话虽如此，我倒也并没有对她望而生厌。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non amavo mia moglie, né la odiavo.

Steam (ST): ...I just didn't care.
Umineko Project (UP): ......I just didn't care.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……どうでも良かったからだ。
Russian (RU): ......Мне просто было всё равно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu simplesmente não me importava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而這是因為，我對她無所謂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而这是因为，我对她无所谓。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Non me ne fregava nulla.

Steam (ST): I fathered a few children, but that wasn't out of love for my wife.
Umineko Project (UP): I fathered a few children, but that wasn't out of love for my wife.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I fathered a few children, but that wasn't out of love for my wife.
PC Japanese (JP): 子供を何人か儲けるが、それも妻を愛していたからではない。
Russian (RU): Я породил нескольких детей, но не из любви к жене.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu concebi algumas crianças, mas não eram pelo amor da minha esposa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然跟她生了好幾個小孩，但這也並不是因為我愛過妻子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然跟她生了好几个小孩，但这也并不是因为我爱过妻子。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Procreai dei bambini, ma non perché amavo mia moglie.

Steam (ST): They were just born before I knew it. ...That's all there was to it.
Umineko Project (UP): They were just born before I knew it. ......That's all there was to it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They were just born before I knew it.......That's all there was to it.
PC Japanese (JP): 気付いたら、勝手に生まれていた。……それだけだ。
Russian (RU): Они просто родились прежде, чем я осознал. ......Вот и всё.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles apenas nasceram antes que eu me desse conta. ......Nada mais do que isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 等注意到時，小孩就自己生出來了。……僅此而已。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 等注意到时，小孩就自己生出来了。……仅此而已。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nacquero prima che me ne accorgessi. ... Fu così e basta.

Steam (ST): None of it mattered. No, that's not quite right.
Umineko Project (UP): None of it mattered. No, that's not quite right.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): None of it mattered. No, that's not quite right.
PC Japanese (JP): 全てが、どうでも良かった。いや、違う。
Russian (RU): Ничто из этого не имело значения. Нет, не совсем так.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nada importava. Não, isso não está bem certo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 全都，無所謂。不，錯了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 全都，无所谓。不，错了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non mi importava nulla. No, non è proprio così.

Steam (ST): ...Everything was decided by someone other than me, and I simply obeyed.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Everything was decided by someone other than me, and I simply obeyed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……全てが、私でない誰かに決められ、私はただ従うだけ。
Russian (RU): ......Всё решили другие, а я просто подчинился.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Tudo foi decidido por outras pessoas, eu simplesmente obedeci.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……全部都是，並非我的別的某人所下的決定，我只管照辦。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……全部都是，并非我的别的某人所下的决定，我只管照办。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tutto veniva deciso da qualcun altro al posto mio, e io obbedivo.

Steam (ST): That was the job... of the "Ushiromiya Family Head"...
Umineko Project (UP): That was the job.........of the "Ushiromiya family head"......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was the job... of the 'Ushiromiya family head'......
PC Japanese (JP): それが、右代宮家の当主という、………仕事だったのだ……。
Russian (RU): Такова была работа...... 'главы семьи Уширомия'......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquele era o trabalho.........do "chefe da família Ushiromiya"......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這就是，右代宮家的當主的，………工作……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这就是，右代宫家的当主的，………工作……。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Yes. On some level, I did feel as though I was being slowly and quietly killed."
Umineko Project (UP): "On some level, I felt as though my life was being slowly and quietly snuffed out."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yes. On some level, I did feel as though I was being slowly and quietly killed."
PC Japanese (JP): 「あぁ、このまま自分は、静かに殺されるなと、うっすらと感じていた。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あぁ、このまま自分は、静かに殺されるなと、うっすらと感じていた」
Russian (RU): "Да... На каком‐то этапе я почувствовал, что меня медленно и тихо убивают."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "De certa forma, eu senti como se minha vida estivesse sendo apagada lentamente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是啊，那時我有隱隱約約地感到，這樣下去，自己將被靜靜扼殺。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是啊，那时我有隐隐约约地感到，这样下去，自己将被静静扼杀。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sì. In un certo senso, sentivo come se mi stessero uccidendo lentamente e in silenzio."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "I can't believe it. To think that you, the one who has been praised for being such a bold and wise ruler, lived life like that for so long..."
Umineko Project (UP): "I can't believe it. You have always been praised for being such a bold and wise ruler, and yet you lived like that for so long......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I can't believe it. To think that you, the one who has been praised for being such a bold and wise ruler, lived life like that for so long......"
PC Japanese (JP): 「信じられません。豪胆なる名君と讃えられたお祖父さまが、そのような日々を送っていたなんて……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「信じられません。豪胆なる名君と讃えられたお祖父さまが、そのような日々を送っていたなんて……」
Russian (RU): "Поверить не могу. Подумать только, что ты, получивший столь высокую оценку за стойкое и мудрое правление, так долго жил подобной жизнью......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não consigo acreditar nisso. Você sempre foi elogiado por ser um líder sábio, rígido e, mesmo assim, você viveu dessa forma por tanto tempo......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「無法相信。被讚譽為大膽明君的爺爺，竟曾過著這般的日子……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「无法相信。被赞誉为大胆明君的爷爷，竟曾过着这般的日子……」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Stento a crederci. Non avrei mai immaginato che tu, colui che è stato lodato per essere un sovrano tanto audace e saggio, avessi vissuto in quel modo per così tanto tempo..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "...Lion, there is nothing so long and faint as a life you do not live for yourself. And yet, it slides on by in the blink of an eye. ...Do not forget this."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Lion. There is nothing so long and insubstantial as a life you do not live for yourself. And yet, it passes in a blink. ......Take this to heart."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Lion. There is nothing so long and faint as a life you do not live for yourself. And yet, it slides on by in the blink of an eye. ......Do not forget this."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……理御よ。自ら生きぬ人生ほど希薄で長いものはない。なのに、それはあっという間に過ぎ去るのだ。……心せよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……理御よ。自ら生きぬ人生ほど希薄で長いものはない。なのに、それはあっという間に過ぎ去るのだ。……心せよ」
Russian (RU): "......Лион. Нет ничего настолько долгого и тусклого, как жизнь не ради себя. И всё равно она проходит в мгновение ока. ......Не забывай."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Lion. Não há nada tão longo e insubstancial do que uma vida que você não vive por si. Ainda assim, passou em um piscar de olhos. ......Ouça com o seu coração."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……理御喲。再也沒有比，不是自主地活著的人生，更空虛漫長的了。可儘管如此，這種歲月卻會一眨眼就飛逝而去。……將此，銘記於心。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……理御哟。再也没有比，不是自主地活着的人生，更空虚漫长的了。可尽管如此，这种岁月却会一眨眼就飞逝而去。……将此，铭记于心。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Lion. Non esiste nulla di tanto lungo e vago quanto una vita che non vivi per te stesso. E tuttavia, se ne va in un baleno. ... Non dimenticarlo."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "A life...you live for yourself..."
Umineko Project (UP): "A life...you live for yourself......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「自ら、生きる人生……。」
Russian (RU): "Жизнь... ради себя......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Uma vida...que você vive por si......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「自主地，活著的人生……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「自主地，活着的人生……」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Una vita... che si vive per se stessi..."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "Living means having your own will. ...You probably were dead during that time."
Umineko Project (UP): "Living means having your own will. ......You probably {i:were} dead during that time."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Living means having your own will. ......You probably were dead during that time."
PC Japanese (JP): 「生きるってことは、意思を持つということだ。……殺された日々だったろうよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「生きるってことは、意思を持つということだ。……殺された日々だったろうよ」
Russian (RU): "Жить значит обладать своей волей. ......Выходит, тогда ты был мёртв."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Viver significa ter vontade própria. ......Você provavelmente {i:esteve} morto durante aquele período."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「所謂活著，即是指，有自己的意志。……那可謂是段，自我被扼殺了的日子吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「所谓活着，即是指，有自己的意志。……那可谓是段，自我被扼杀了的日子吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Vivere vuol dire possedere una volontà. ... Probabilmente eri morto durante quel periodo."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Precisely. I wanted to live. No, I wanted to die. ...How can a puppet die?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Precisely. I wanted to live. No, I wanted to die. ......What must a puppet do to die?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Precisely. I wanted to live. No, I wanted to die. ......How can a puppet die?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだ。私は生きたかった。いや、死にたかった。……操り人形はどうすれば死ねる？」
Russian (RU): "Именно. Я хотел жить. Нет, я хотел умереть. ......Как марионетка может умереть?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Precisamente. Eu queria viver. Não, eu queria morrer. ......O que uma marionete precisa para morrer?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是的。我想活。不，我想死。……提線木偶要怎麼死？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是的。我想活。不，我想死。……提线木偶要怎么死？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Precisamente. Volevo vivere. No, volevo morire. ... Come può un burattino morire?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "...... ...By cutting...the strings."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...............By cutting...the strings."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………………。……糸を、断ち切ることです。」
Russian (RU): "...............Если перерезать... нити."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Recidendo... i suoi fili."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Correct. That would be death, and it would also be life, ...since it would mean being free."
Umineko Project (UP): "Correct. That would be death, it would be life, and it would be......release."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Correct. That would be death, and it would also be life, ...since it would mean being free."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだ。それが死ぬことであり、生きることであり、……解放だ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうだ。それが死ぬことであり、生きることであり、……解放だ」
Russian (RU): "Правильно. Это смерть, а также жизнь, ...потому что обретаешь свободу."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Correto. Isto seria a morte, seria a vida, seria também......a libertação"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「對。這是種，既是去死又是獲生的，……解脫。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「对。这是种，既是去死又是获生的，……解脱。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Corretto. Quella sarebbe morte, ma sarebbe anche vita... poiché significherebbe essere liberi."

Steam (ST): Before I realized it, trouble was brewing in the world.
Umineko Project (UP): Before I realized it, the world had grown troubled.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 気付けば、世界は慌しくなっていた。
Russian (RU): Не успел я осознать, как в мире начались беспорядки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Antes que eu percebesse, o mundo havia se tornado mais complicado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 等意識到時，世界已變得不再安穩。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 等意识到时，世界已变得不再安稳。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Prima di accorgermene, il mondo cominciò ad agitarsi.

Steam (ST): World War II. The Pacific War.
Umineko Project (UP): World War II. The Pacific War.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): World War II. The Pacific War.
PC Japanese (JP): 第二次世界大戦。太平洋戦争。
Russian (RU): Вторая мировая война. Тихоокеанская война.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Segunda Guerra Mundial. A Guerra do Pacífico.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 第二次世界大戰。太平洋戰爭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 第二次世界大战。太平洋战争。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Seconda Guerra Mondiale. Guerra del Pacifico.

Steam (ST): Japan had extended their war fronts too far to the East and West, and the tide of war was changing.
Umineko Project (UP): Japan had extended their war fronts too far to the East and West, and the tide of war was changing.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Japan had extended their war fronts too far to the East and West, and the tide of war was changing.
PC Japanese (JP): 日本は東西に戦線を広げ過ぎ、その風向きは変わりつつあった。
Russian (RU): Япония слишком далеко продвинула свои военные фронты на восток и запад, изменив ход войны.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Japão havia estendido muito suas frentes de batalha para Leste e Oeste; a maré da guerra estava mudando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 日本將東面與西面的戰線拉得太長，形勢漸漸地變了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 日本将东面与西面的战线拉得太长，形势渐渐地变了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il Giappone aveva esteso fin troppo i propri fronti in occidente e in oriente, e il corso della guerra stava cambiando.

Steam (ST): Thanks to the influence of the elders, I was able to avoid conscription.
Umineko Project (UP): Thanks to the influence of the elders, I was able to avoid conscription.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Thanks to the influence of the elders, I was able to avoid conscription.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は長老たちの働き掛けにより、徴兵が免除されていた。
Russian (RU): Благодаря влиянию старейшин я избежал призыва в армию.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Graças às influências dos mais velhos, eu fui capaz de evitar a conscrição.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我受到長老們的幫助，免於徵兵。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我受到长老们的帮助，免于征兵。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Grazie all'influenza degli anziani, riuscii ad evitare l'arruolamento.

Steam (ST): ...Of course, this was not out of compassion for me. It was because I was their precious puppet.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Of course, this was not out of compassion for me. It was because I was their precious puppet.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……もちろん慈悲ではない。彼らの大切なお人形だからだ。
Russian (RU): ......Разумеется, это было не из сострадания ко мне, а потому что я был их драгоценной марионеткой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......É claro, isso não foi por compaixão. Era porque eu era a preciosa marionete deles.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……當然這不是出於好心。只是因為，我是他們重要的人偶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……当然这不是出于好心。只是因为，我是他们重要的人偶。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ovviamente, non lo fecero per compassione. Lo fecero solo perché ero la loro preziosa marionetta.

Steam (ST): So, the war never really felt that close to me. However, when I personally decided to abandon their protection, it was very easy.
Umineko Project (UP): So, the war never really felt that close to me.{n}However, when I personally decided to abandon their protection, it was very easy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, the war never really felt that close to me. However, when I personally decided to abandon their protection, it was very easy.
PC Japanese (JP): だから戦争を、それほど身近に感じていなかった。しかし、私が自らそれを返上したいと望めば、それはとても容易い。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): だから戦争を、それほど身近に感じていなかった。{n}しかし、私が自らそれを返上したいと望めば、それはとても容易い。
Russian (RU): Но по этой причине война никогда не была мне близка.{n}Тем не менее, когда я сам решил, отказаться от их опеки было просто.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, eu nunca cheguei a sentir a guerra de perto.{n}Mas, quando eu decidi, pessoalmente, abandonar a proteção deles, foi bem fácil.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，我並沒有怎麼感到，戰爭離自己很近。{n}不過，我一去自行請願，別幫我免去徵兵，這事倒是非常容易地就如願以償了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，我并没有怎么感到，战争离自己很近。{n}不过，我一去自行请愿，别帮我免去征兵，这事倒是非常容易地就如愿以偿了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò, non sentii mai la guerra vicina a me. Tuttavia, quando decisi personalmente di abbandonare la loro protezione, fu molto facile.

Steam (ST): At that time, the Ushiromiya family had almost completely collapsed, and since the elders had apparently gathered enough of the scraps to last them the rest of their lives, they seemed to care little for what I did, now that they no longer had any use for me.
Umineko Project (UP): At that time, the Ushiromiya family had almost completely collapsed, and since the elders had apparently pilfered enough of the scraps to last them the rest of their lives, they seemed to care little for what I did, now that they no longer had any use for me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At that time, the Ushiromiya family had almost completely collapsed, and since the elders had apparently gathered enough of the scraps to last them the rest of their lives, they seemed to care little for what I did, now that they no longer had any use for me.
PC Japanese (JP): その頃には、右代宮家は完全に没落しかかっており、長老たちは、自分たちの寿命分程度には財産をくすねられたようで、もはや用済みの私が何をしようと、関心はないようだった。
Russian (RU): В то время семья Уширомия была на грани краха. Старейшины собрали достаточно имущества, чтобы продержаться до конца жизни, поэтому их мало заботило то, чем я занимался, раз я больше не приносил им пользы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquela época, a família Ushiromiya já havia desmoronado quase que por completo, e como os mais velhos já pareciam ter passado a mão no que sobrou para poderem viver o resto de suas vidas, eles pouco se importaram com o que eu fazia, afinal já não tinham mais uso para mim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在那時，右代宮家已完全瀕臨沒落，長老們好像是撈夠自己餘生所能享用的錢了，已經沒用了的我想做什麼，他們似乎已不再關心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在那时，右代宫家已完全濒临没落，长老们好像是捞够自己余生所能享用的钱了，已经没用了的我想做什么，他们似乎已不再关心。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In quel periodo, la famiglia Ushiromiya era crollata quasi completamente, e dato che, apparentemente, gli anziani avevano riunito tutti gli avanzi perché durassero loro per il resto delle loro vite, sembrava che non importasse loro ciò che io facevo, ora che non potevano più sfruttarmi.

Steam (ST): So, I realized that I had finally found my time to die.
Umineko Project (UP): So, I realized that I had finally found my time to die.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, I realized that I had finally found my time to die.
PC Japanese (JP): だから私は、ようやく、死ねる時を得たのだと悟った。
Russian (RU): Я понял, что наконец нашёл подходящее время умереть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, eu percebi que eu finalmente tinha encontrado a minha hora de morrer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以我悟到了，我總算是能死了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以我悟到了，我总算是能死了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, mi accorsi di aver finalmente trovato il momento per morire.

Steam (ST): One by one, I cut the threads I was hanging from, ...and began to search ... for a place to end my life.
Umineko Project (UP): One by one, I cut the threads I was hanging from, ......and began to search......for a place to end my life.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): One by one, I cut the threads I was hanging from, ......and began to search for a place to end my life.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は自らを吊っていた糸を、一本一本、切り落とし、……死ねる場所を探し始めた。
Russian (RU): Я перерезал нити, за которые меня тянули...... и стал искать место для смерти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um por um, eu fui cortando os fios que me seguravam, ......e comecei a procurar......por um lugar para terminar a minha vida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我把吊著自己的線，一根一根地，剪斷，……開始尋找起了，自己的葬身之所。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我把吊着自己的线，一根一根地，剪断，……开始寻找起了，自己的葬身之所。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Uno ad uno, tagliai i fili a cui ero appeso... e iniziai a cercare un luogo in cui porre fine alla mia vita.

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "So, you searched for death on the battlefield?"
Umineko Project (UP): "So, you searched for death on the battlefield?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「戦地で死を、求めようとしたのか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「戦地で死を、求めようとしたのか」
Russian (RU): "Так ты искал смерть на поле боя?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E então, você foi procurar pela morte no campo de batalha?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你是想在，戰場上死嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你是想在，战场上死吗？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Quindi cercavi un modo per morire nel campo di battaglia?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "...I thought that if I was going to die anyway, I should try to be of some use to my country. ...No, that's a lie. I probably just lacked the willpower to end my own life. War was a suitable excuse for death."
Umineko Project (UP): "......I thought that if I was going to die anyway, I should try to be of some use to someone. ......No, that's a lie. I probably just lacked the willpower to end my own life. War was a suitable excuse for death."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I thought that if I was going to die anyway, I should try to be of some use to my country. ......No, that's a lie. I probably just lacked the willpower to end my own life. War was a suitable excuse for death."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……同じ死ぬなら、御国の役に立つべきと思った。……いや、違うな。私には自らの命を絶つ気力さえなかったのだろう。もっともらしく死ねる理由が、戦争だったのだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……同じ死ぬなら、誰かの役に立つべきと思った。……いや、違うな。私には自らの命を絶つ気力さえなかったのだろう。もっともらしく死ねる理由が、戦争だったのだ」
Russian (RU): "......Я думал, что если в любом случае умру, нужно принести пользу стране. ......Нет, неправда. Возможно, мне просто не хватило силы воли покончить с собой. Война была подходящим предлогом для смерти."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu pensei que se fosse morrer de um forma ou de outra, ao menos eu deveria tentar ser útil para alguém. ......Não, isso é mentira. Eu provavelmente não tinha a força de vontade o suficiente para acabar com a minha própria vida sozinho. Guerras são uma boa desculpa para morrer."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……我想到了，既然同樣是死，那麼應當對某人有用。……不，錯了。我是連了結自己性命的精神頭都沒有了吧。最像那麼回事的能去死的藉口，就是戰爭。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……我想到了，既然同样是死，那么应当对某人有用。……不，错了。我是连了结自己性命的精神头都没有了吧。最像那么回事的能去死的借口，就是战争。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Pensai che se dovessi comunque morire, avrei dovuto almeno provare ad essere utile alla mia patria. ... No, è una bugia. Probabilmente mancavo della volontà di suicidarmi. La guerra era una scusa adatta per morire."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "I heard that Grandfather had knowledge necessary for public works projects and construction, so he was tasked with setting up facilities for the Navy construction team."
Umineko Project (UP): "I heard that your knowledge in public works and construction...led to you being tasked with setting up facilities for the Navy construction team."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I heard that Grandfather had knowledge in public works and construction, so he was tasked with setting up facilities for the Navy construction team."
PC Japanese (JP): 「お祖父さまは土木・建築の知識がありましたので、海軍設営隊にて、施設造成などに従事されたと聞いています。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お祖父さまは土木・建築の知識がありましたので、海軍設営隊にて、施設造成などに従事されたと聞いています」
Russian (RU): "По слухам, дедушка разбирался в общественных работах и строительстве, поэтому ему дали задание построить сооружения для строительной бригады военно‐морского флота."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu ouvi que os conhecimentos do vovô sobre obras públicas e construções...o levaram a ficar encarregado do desenvolvimento de instalações para a equipe de construção da Marinha."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我聽說，爺爺因為有土木建築的知識，所以曾在海軍建設隊，從事過建造設施等工作。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我听说，爷爷因为有土木建筑的知识，所以曾在海军建设队，从事过建造设施等工作。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ho sentito che il Nonno possedeva delle competenze nei lavori pubblici e l'edilizia, perciò gli venne dato il compito di preparare impianti per la squadra edile della Marina."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Hmph, and what a foolish mistake that was. If only I had just said that I had no useful skills, I could have been sent to the dangerous front lines right away..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Hmph, and what a miscalculation that was. If I had just said that I had no useful skills, I would have been sent to the front lines where I could die at a moment's notice..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hmph, and what a foolish mistake that was. If only I had just said that I had no useful skills, I could have been sent to the dangerous front lines right away..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ふっ、とんだ誤算よ。何の取り得もないと言っておけば、すぐにも死ねる最前線へ送られたものを…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ふっ、とんだ誤算よ。何の取り得もないと言っておけば、すぐにも死ねる最前線へ送られたものを…」
Russian (RU): "Хмф, до чего глупая ошибка. Скажи я, что у меня нет полезных навыков, меня бы сразу отправили на опасную линию фронта..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hmph, e que grande erro de cálculo eu cometi. Se eu simplesmente tivesse dito que não tinha nenhuma habilidade, eu teria sido mandado para as linhas de frente, onde poderia morrer de uma vez..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哼，棋錯一步啊。要是講了我沒任何長處的話，就能立刻被送去能死掉的最前線了…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哼，棋错一步啊。要是讲了我没任何长处的话，就能立刻被送去能死掉的最前线了…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Hmph, e che stupido errore fu. Se solo avessi detto di non avere delle abilità particolari, sarei stato subito spedito al pericoloso fronte..."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "So, you didn't need to go to the front lines?"
Umineko Project (UP): "So, you ended up not having to go to the front lines?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "So, you didn't need to go to the front lines?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「最前線に行かずに済んだのか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「最前線に行かずに済んだのか」
Russian (RU): "Так тебе не пришлось ехать на фронт?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então, acabou que você não foi para as linhas de frente?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你不用去最前線了麼？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你不用去最前线了么？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Perciò non avevi bisogno di stare sul fronte?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Some of the others were overjoyed at their luck. It was the opposite for me. I had only wanted to get drunk on the liquor known as dying for the sake of one's country. ...The US planes did nothing but cut across the skies of that forgotten island. ...They didn't have even a bullet to spare for me, much less a bomb."
Umineko Project (UP): "Some of the others were overjoyed at their luck. It was the opposite for me. My only desire was to get my hands on the intoxicating liquor of battle and drink myself to death. ......The US planes did nothing but cut across the skies of that forsaken island. ......They didn't have even a bullet to spare for me, much less a bomb."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Some of the others were overjoyed at their luck. It was the opposite for me. I had only wanted to get drunk on the liquor known as dying for the sake of one's country. ......The US planes did nothing but cut across the skies of that forgotten island. ......They didn't have even a bullet to spare for me, much less a bomb."
PC Japanese (JP): 「幸いと喜ぶ仲間もいたよ。私には逆だった。御国のために戦って死ぬという、出来すぎた美酒のヤケ酒が欲しかっただけなのだ。……忘れられた島の上空を、米軍の編隊は横切っていくだけ。……彼らは私のために、爆弾一つどころか、鉛弾の一つさえ恵んではくれなかったのだよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「幸いと喜ぶ仲間もいたよ。私には逆だった。戦って死ぬという、出来すぎた美酒のヤケ酒が欲しかっただけなのだ。……忘れられた島の上空を、米軍の編隊は横切っていくだけ。……彼らは私のために、爆弾一つどころか、鉛弾の一つさえ恵んではくれなかったのだよ」
Russian (RU): "Некоторые были вне себя от радости. Но только не я. Я просто хотел напиться ликёра, известного как смерть на благо страны. ......Самолёты США лишь пересекали небеса над этим забытым островом. ......Для меня там не было даже пули, а уж тем более бомбы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Alguns certamente ficariam muito contentes com uma sorte dessas. Mas para mim, era o contrário. Meu único desejo era colocar as mãos no intoxicante licor da guerra e embebedar‐me até a morte. ......Os aviões estadunidenses não faziam nada além de cruzar os céus da ilha abandonada. ......Eles não tinham munição para gastar comigo, muito menos bombas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「也是有同伴為走運而高興不已的。但我卻完全相反。我只想自暴自棄地痛飲，名為“戰死”的美過頭了的美酒。……在被遺忘的島嶼的上空，美軍的編隊一直都只是橫穿而過。……他們豈止是沒為我扔下一顆炸彈，連鉛彈都沒賞過一顆。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「也是有同伴为走运而高兴不已的。但我却完全相反。我只想自暴自弃地痛饮，名为“战死”的美过头了的美酒。……在被遗忘的岛屿的上空，美军的编队一直都只是横穿而过。……他们岂止是没为我扔下一颗炸弹，连铅弹都没赏过一颗。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Tra gli altri c'era qualcuno pazzo di gioia per la sua fortuna. Per me era il contrario. Volevo solo ubriacarmi del liquore conosciuto come morte per il bene della mia nazione. ... Gli aerei americani non facevano altro che passare attraverso i cieli di quell'isola dimenticata. ... Non avevano nemmeno un proiettile da offrirmi, tanto meno una bomba."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion

Umineko Project (UP): "Is this the time you met Beatrice, Grandfather......?"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Foi quando o senhor encontrou a Beatrice, vovô......?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「爺爺是在這段日子裡，見到了貝阿朵莉切嗎……？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「爷爷是在这段日子里，见到了贝阿朵莉切吗……？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Fu questo il periodo in cui incontrasti Beatrice, Nonno...?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Correct. She came to me from the sea..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Correct. She came to me from the sea......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだ。あれは、海からやってきた……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうだ。あれは、海からやってきた……」
Russian (RU): "Верно. Она пришла ко мне из моря......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. Ela veio até mim pelo mar......"

Steam (ST): Due to the honorable defeats at Saipan and Guam, Japan's Absolute National Defense Zone strategy was in shambles.
Umineko Project (UP): Due to the honorable defeats at Saipan and Guam, Japan's Absolute National Defense Zone strategy was in shambles.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Due to the honorable defeats at Saipan and Guam, Japan's Absolute National Defense Zone strategy was in shambles.
PC Japanese (JP): サイパン、グアムの玉砕により、日本の絶対国防圏は破られた。
Russian (RU): Из‐за почётных поражений на Сайпане и Гуаме абсолютная национальная зона обороны Японии была разрушена.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Devido às honrosas derrotas em Saipan e Guam, a estratégia da Zona de Defesa Japonesa Absoluta estava uma bagunça.
