Chinese Simplified (CN): 随着{c:86EF9C:塞班岛与关岛}的壮烈败阵，日本的绝对国防圈被攻破了。{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书同名条目）}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A causa delle onorevoli sconfitte di Saipan e di Guam, la strategia del Giappone della Zona di Difesa Nazionale Assoluta stava crollando.

Steam (ST): Where had the gallantry shown at Pearl Harbor gone? The old attackers were now the ones on the defensive.
Umineko Project (UP): Where had the gallantry of the start of the war gone?{n}The old attackers were now the ones on the defensive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Where had the gallantry shown at Pearl Harbor gone? The old attackers were now the ones on the defensive.
PC Japanese (JP): 真珠湾の勇ましさはどこへやら。戦局はすでに、守勢へ完全に変わっていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 開戦時の勇ましさはどこへやら。{n}戦局はすでに、守勢へ完全に変わっていた。
Russian (RU): Куда только делась отвага, проявленная на Пёрл‐Харбор?{n}Бывшие нападающие теперь были в обороне.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para onde foi a galanteria do início da guerra?{n}Os então atacantes agora estavam na defensiva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 別提開戰時的勇猛跑哪去了。{n}戰局已完全轉變為了守勢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 别提开战时的勇猛跑哪去了。{n}战局已完全转变为了守势。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dov'era finito il coraggio mostrato a Pearl Harbor? I vecchi aggressori diventarono coloro che stavano sulla difensiva.

Steam (ST): At that time, it was said that the last trump card for the Japanese military was a type of manned torpedo known as the Kaiten.
Umineko Project (UP): At that time, it was said that the final trump cards for the Japanese military were the so‐called "special attack weapons".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At that time, it was said that the last trump card for the Japanese military was a type of manned torpedo known as the Kaiten.
PC Japanese (JP): 当時、日本海軍の最後の切り札と呼ばれたのは、回天と呼ばれる人間魚雷だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 当時、日本海軍の最後の切り札と呼ばれたのは、いわゆる特攻兵器だった。
Russian (RU): Тогда было сказано, что последний козырь японской армии — пилотируемые торпеды, известные как кайтен.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquela época, foi dito que a última cartada das forças militares japonesas era uma espécie de {i:torpedo humano} chamado "Kaiten".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當時，被稱為日本海軍的最後王牌的，是所謂的“{c:86EF9C:特攻兵器}”。{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書同名條目）}
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当时，被称为日本海军的最后王牌的，是所谓的“{c:86EF9C:特攻兵器}”。{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书同名条目）}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A quel tempo, si diceva che l'ultimo asso nella manica dell'esercito giapponese fosse un tipo di torpedo fornito di equipaggio conosciuto come il Kaiten.

Steam (ST): It was said that these ultimate weapons, packed with 1.55 tons of explosives, were capable of sinking any kind of warship with a single blast.
Umineko Project (UP): It was said that these ultimate weapons were packed with 1.55 tons of explosives...and capable of sinking any kind of warship with a single blast.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was said that these ultimate weapons were packed with 1.55 tons of explosives and capable of sinking any kind of warship with a single blast.
PC Japanese (JP): この有人操縦魚雷は、１．５５トンもの炸薬を搭載した強力無比なものであり、その一撃は如何なる艦船でも葬り去ると言われた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): これは１.５５トンもの炸薬を搭載した強力無比なものであり、その一撃は如何なる艦船でも葬り去ると言われた。
Russian (RU): Говорилось, что в этом конечном оружии запаковано 1.55 тонн взрывчатки и что оно может за один удар потопить любой корабль. Чтобы укрепить защиту родины,
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Foi dito que essas armas supremas estava recheadas com 1.55 toneladas de explosivos...e capazes de afundar qualquer navio de guerra com uma única explosão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 據說，這是個搭載著多達 1.55 吨的炸藥的強力無比的玩意兒，它的一擊可埋葬任何艦船。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 据说，这是个搭载着多达 1.55 吨的炸药的强力无比的玩意儿，它的一击可埋葬任何舰船。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si diceva che queste armi definitive fossero stipate con 1. 55 tonnellate di esplosivi e che fossero capaci di affondare qualunque tipo di nave da guerra con un solo colpo.

Steam (ST): To strengthen homeland defense, the Navy drafted a plan to build a string of hidden bases from Hachijo Island to Yokosuka, all to house submarines loaded with Kaiten torpedoes.
Umineko Project (UP): To strengthen homeland defense, the Navy drafted a plan to build a string of hidden bases from Hachijojima to Yokosuka, all to house submarines loaded with special attack weapons.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To strengthen homeland defense, the Navy drafted a plan to build a string of hidden bases from Hachijo Island to Yokosuka, all to house submarines loaded with Kaiten torpedoes.
PC Japanese (JP): 海軍は、本土防衛のため、八丈島と横須賀を結ぶ線上に、回天搭載潜水艦の秘密基地建造計画を立案する。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 海軍は、本土防衛のため、八丈島と横須賀を結ぶ線上に、特攻兵器搭載潜水艦の秘密基地建造計画を立案する。
Russian (RU): военно‐морской флот разработал план по строительству линии скрытых баз от острова Хачиджо до Йокосуки для субмарин, загруженных торпедами кайтен.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para fortalecer as defesas da pátria, a Marinha traçou um plano para construir uma cadeia de bases, de Hachijojima até Yokosuka, com o intuito de abrigar todos os submarinos carregados com esses torpedos de {i:ataque especial}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 海軍為防衛本土，擬定計劃，在連接著八丈島與橫須賀的那條線上建造了，搭載“特攻兵器”的潛水艇的秘密基地。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 海军为防卫本土，拟定计划，在连接着八丈岛与横须贺的那条线上建造了，搭载“特攻兵器”的潜水艇的秘密基地。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per rafforzare la difesa della madrepatria, la Marina creò un piano per costruire una serie di basi segrete dall'Isola Hachijo a Yokosuka, tutto per ospitare sottomarini pieni di torpedo Kaiten.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "I knew that there was a Kaiten base constructed on Hachijo Island, but was there actually one on Rokkenjima too...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "I knew that there was a base constructed on Hachijojima. To think there was one on Rokkenjima too......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I knew that there was a Kaiten base constructed on Hachijo Island, but was there actually one on Rokkenjima too......?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「八丈島に回天の基地が作られたことは知っていました。しかしそれが、六軒島にもあったなんて……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「八丈島に基地が作られたことは知っていました。しかしそれが、六軒島にもあったなんて……」
Russian (RU): "Я знаю, что база кайтен была построена на острове Хачиджо, но такая же была и на Роккенджиме?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu sabia que havia sido construída uma base em Hachijojima. Mas pensar que havia uma em Rokkenjima também......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我知道，在八丈島曾建過“特攻兵器”的基地。不過真沒想到，竟在六軒島也有……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我知道，在八丈岛曾建过“特攻兵器”的基地。不过真没想到，竟在六轩岛也有……」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sapevo che esisteva una base di Kaiten costruita nell'isola Hachijo, ma in realtà ce n'era una anche su Rokkenjima...?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "What fool decided it would be a good idea to plant a base on this desolate island? ...To better preserve its secrecy? Hmph, ridiculous. ...I could never understand what the higher-ups were thinking, and I didn't particularly want to."
Umineko Project (UP): "Just what sort of fool decided it would be a good idea to plant a base on this desolate island, I have no idea. ......To better preserve its secrecy? Hmph, ridiculous. ......I could never understand what the higher‐ups were thinking, and I didn't particularly care."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Just what sort of fool decided it would be a good idea to plant a base on this desolate island. ......To better preserve its secrecy? Hmph, ridiculous. ......I could never understand what the higher-ups were thinking, and I didn't particularly want to."
PC Japanese (JP): 「どこの間抜けがこんな何もない島に作ろうと言い出したやら。……秘匿上の都合？　ふ、馬鹿馬鹿しい。……お上の考えることなどわからぬし、私にとってもどうでもいいことだった。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「どこの間抜けがこんな何もない島に作ろうと言い出したやら。……秘匿上の都合？　ふ、馬鹿馬鹿しい。……お上の考えることなどわからぬし、私にとってもどうでもいいことだった」
Russian (RU): "Просто один дурак решил, что построить на этом безлюдном острове базу — хорошая идея. ......Чтобы лучше сохранить её секретность? Хмф, чушь. ......Я никогда не понимал, о чём думает начальство, да и не особо хотел."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não faço ideia de qual idiota achou que seria uma boa ideia implantar uma base em uma ilha desconhecida dessas. ......Para preservar melhor seus segredos? Hmph, ridículo. ......Eu nunca poderia entender o que aqueles oficiais estavam pensando e, pessoalmente, pouco me importava."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「都是哪個白痴講出，在這種什麼都沒有的島上建基地的啊？……因為隱秘？哼，荒謬荒謬。……搞不懂上面怎麼想的，而這對我來說也根本無所謂。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「都是哪个白痴讲出，在这种什么都没有的岛上建基地的啊？……因为隐秘？哼，荒谬荒谬。……搞不懂上面怎么想的，而这对我来说也根本无所谓。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Che razza di idiota decise che sarebbe stata una buona idea piazzare una base su quest'isola deserta. ... Per preservare meglio la sua segretezza? Hmph, ridicolo. Non riuscii mai a capire ciò a cui i superiori stavano pensando, e non volevo veramente farlo."

Steam (ST): The Kaiten, which could finish off a large warship with a single strike, truly was an ultimate weapon.
Umineko Project (UP): These truly were ultimate weapons, able to take down large warships in a single strike.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The Kaiten, which could finish off a large warship with a single strike, truly was an ultimate weapon.
PC Japanese (JP): 大型艦船を一撃で葬れる回天はまさに、必殺の兵器。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 大型艦船を一撃で葬れるそれはまさに、必殺の兵器。
Russian (RU): Кайтен, способные с одного удара уничтожить большой военный корабль, и вправду были конечным оружием.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas eram verdadeiras armas supremas, capazes de abater navios de guerra de grande porte com um único ataque.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 能一擊埋葬大型艦船的那個東西簡直就正是，必殺的兵器。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 能一击埋葬大型舰船的那个东西简直就正是，必杀的兵器。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il Kaiten, che poteva distruggere un'intera nave da guerra con un solo colpo, era davvero un'arma definitiva.

Steam (ST): It was hoped that the presence of submarines capable of loading these weapons in the waters just off of Japan would allow for a powerful sea ambush as a final line of defense.
Umineko Project (UP): It was hoped that the presence of submarines capable of loading these weapons in the waters just off of Japan would allow for a powerful sea ambush as a final line of defense.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was hoped that the presence of submarines capable of loading these weapons in the waters just off of Japan would allow for a powerful sea ambush as a final line of defense.
PC Japanese (JP): それを搭載する潜水艦は本土近海での最終決戦で、強力な海の伏兵となることが期待された。
Russian (RU): Была надежда, что наличие субмарин, в которые можно загрузить такое оружие, в водах близ Японии позволит устроить мощную морскую засаду — последнюю линию обороны.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esperava‐se que a presença de submarinos capazes de transportar essas armas em águas fora do Japão fosse permitir uma poderosa emboscada marinha como sendo a última linha defensiva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他們是期待，搭載它的潛水艇能在本土近海的最終決戰中，成為大海中的強力伏兵吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他们是期待，搭载它的潜水艇能在本土近海的最终决战中，成为大海中的强力伏兵吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si sperava che la presenza di sottomarini capaci di caricare queste armi nelle acque al di fuori del Giappone avrebbe permesso una potente imboscata marittima come ultima linea di difesa.

Steam (ST): So, to aid in the establishment of a base with absolute secrecy, the uninhabited island Rokkenjima was raised as a possible candidate.
Umineko Project (UP): So, to aid in the establishment of a base with absolute secrecy, the uninhabited island Rokkenjima was raised as a possible candidate.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, to aid in the establishment of a base with absolute secrecy, the uninhabited island Rokkenjima was raised as a possible candidate.
PC Japanese (JP): そのため、絶対秘匿の秘密基地とするため、無人島である六軒島が候補に上がった。
Russian (RU): И так кандидатом для постройки базы в абсолютной секретности стал необитаемый остров, Роккенджима.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, para ajudar no estabelecimento de uma base com total sigilo, a ilha de Rokkenjima foi sugerida como possível candidata.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，為建設絕對隱秘的秘密基地，作為無人島的六軒島進入了候選名單。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，为建设绝对隐秘的秘密基地，作为无人岛的六轩岛进入了候选名单。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Perciò, la disabitata Rokkenjima fu presentata come possibile candidata in cui fondare una base con assoluta segretezza.

Steam (ST): An investigation of the island resulted in the discovery of a large cave in the cliffs, and this was apparently deemed to be a suitable location for a submarine base.
Umineko Project (UP): An investigation of the island resulted in the discovery of a large cave in the cliffs, and this was apparently deemed to be a suitable location for a submarine base.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): An investigation of the island resulted in the discovery of a large cave in the cliffs, and this was apparently deemed to be a suitable location for a submarine base.
PC Japanese (JP): 調査の結果、岸壁に大きな洞窟が発見され、潜水艦基地に転用することが充分可能と判断されたらしい。
Russian (RU): Исследование острова привело к находке в скалах большой пещеры, и она, как посчитали, была подходящим местом для базы субмарин.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma investigação na ilha resultou na descoberta de uma grande caverna nas falésias da ilha, e aparentemente foi considerada como sendo um local apropriado para uma base de submarinos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 經調查，在岸壁上發現了個巨大的洞窟，而此洞好像是被判斷為，足以轉用於潛水艇基地。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 经调查，在岸壁上发现了个巨大的洞窟，而此洞好像是被判断为，足以转用于潜水艇基地。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tramite un'investigazione dell'isola, venne scoperta un'ampia caverna tra i dirupi, e apparentemente, si reputò che fosse un'ubicazione adatta per una base sottomarina.

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "So, you were tasked with aiding in the establishment of that base?"
Umineko Project (UP): "So, you were tasked with aiding in the establishment of that base?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「お前は、その基地の建設にかかわったわけか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お前は、その基地の建設にかかわったわけか」
Russian (RU): "И ты получил задание помочь с постройкой этой базы?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então, você ficou encarregado de auxiliar no desenvolvimento dessa base?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你是參與了，這個基地的建設麼？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你是参与了，这个基地的建设么？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Quindi, fosti incaricato di aiutare nella fondazione di quella base?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Establishment? Certainly, if you can call digging out a cave "establishment". Not only that, the base was abandoned before its completion."
Umineko Project (UP): "Establishment? Certainly, if you can call digging out a cave "establishment". Not only that, the base was abandoned before its completion."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Establishment? Certainly, if you can call digging out a cave 'establishment'. Not only that, the base was abandoned before its completion."
PC Japanese (JP): 「建設？　ふっ、岩窟を掘り広げただけを、建設と呼ぶならな。しかもその上、基地は未完成のまま放置されたのだから。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「建設？　ふっ、岩窟を掘り広げただけを、建設と呼ぶならな。しかもその上、基地は未完成のまま放置されたのだから」
Russian (RU): "С постройкой? Конечно, если выкапывание пещеры можно назвать постройкой. К тому же, база была заброшена до того, как её построили."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Desenvolvimento? Bem, se você considerar cavar uma caverna como "desenvolvimento". Não apenas isso, a base foi abandonada antes de ficar pronta."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「建設？哼，如果只是把岩洞挖得更大，能叫建設的話。畢竟，不僅如此，基地還沒完成就被這麼放著不管了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「建设？哼，如果只是把岩洞挖得更大，能叫建设的话。毕竟，不仅如此，基地还没完成就被这么放着不管了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Fondazione? Certamente, se per ‘fondazione’ si intende scavare una grotta. Non solo, la base venne abbandonata prima del suo completamento."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "Why?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Why?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「どうしてです？」
Russian (RU): "Почему?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Por quê?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「為什麼會這樣？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「为什么会这样？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Perché?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "Wahahahahaha! Because at that time, Japan no longer had any submarines large enough to transport a Kaiten torpedo. How truly laughable. What's the point in having a submarine base if there aren't any submarines left? If there's one thing that never changes, it's politicians and their meaningless projects."
Umineko Project (UP): "Wahahahahaha! Because at that time, Japan no longer had any submarines large enough to carry one of those weapons. How truly laughable. What's the point in having a submarine base if there aren't any submarines left? If there's one thing that never changes, it's politicians and their meaningless projects."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Wahahahahaha! Because at that time, Japan no longer had any submarines large enough to transport a Kaiten torpedo. How truly laughable. What's the point in having a submarine base if there aren't any submarines left? If there's one thing that never changes, it's politicians and their meaningless projects."
PC Japanese (JP): 「わっははははっはっは！　当時の日本に、回天を積めるほどの大型潜水艦はもう、残っていなかったのよ。滑稽な話だ。潜水艦もないのに、潜水艦基地など今さら、必要なものか。役人の無意味な箱物作りは、今も昔も変わらぬわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わっははははっはっは！　当時の日本に、そいつを積めるほどの大型潜水艦はもう、残っていなかったのよ。滑稽な話だ。潜水艦もないのに、潜水艦基地など今さら、必要なものか。役人の無意味な箱物作りは、今も昔も変わらぬわ」
Russian (RU): "Ва‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха! Потому что тогда у Японии закончились достаточно большие субмарины для перевозки торпед кайтен. До чего нелепо. Какой смысл строить базу субмарин, если никаких субмарин не осталось? Если и есть что‐то, что никогда не изменится, так это политики и их бессмысленные проекты."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Wahahahahaha! Porque, naquela época, o Japão já não tinha mais nenhum submarino grande o suficiente para carregar aquelas armas. Realmente ridículo. Qual o sentido de ter uma base de submarinos se você não tem submarinos? Se tem uma coisa que nunca muda, são os políticos e seus projetos sem sentido."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哇、哈哈哈哈、哈、哈！當時的日本，早就不剩能裝下“特攻兵器”的大型潛水艇了。真是滑稽。明明都沒潛水艇了，事到如今怎麼可能還需要潛水艇基地呢？官僚們毫無意義的“展品工程”，現在也好過去也罷，一直都沒變過呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哇、哈哈哈哈、哈、哈！当时的日本，早就不剩能装下“特攻兵器”的大型潜水艇了。真是滑稽。明明都没潜水艇了，事到如今怎么可能还需要潜水艇基地呢？官僚们毫无意义的“展品工程”，现在也好过去也罢，一直都没变过呢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Wahahahahaha! Perché a quel tempo, il Giappone non possedeva più sottomarini abbastanza larghi da poter trasportare un torpedo Kaiten. È ridicolo. Che senso ha avere una base per i sottomarini se non ne è rimasto nemmeno uno? Se c'è una cosa che non cambia mai, sono i politici e i loro progetti senza senso."

Steam (ST): The base on Hachijo Island was outfitted with Kaiten torpedoes and became a base for direct attacks, but Rokkenjima was never supplied with any.
Umineko Project (UP): The base on Hachijojima was actually outfitted with those weapons and became a base for direct attacks, but Rokkenjima was never supplied with any.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The base on Hachijo Island was outfitted with Kaiten torpedoes and became a base for direct attacks, but Rokkenjima was never supplied with any.
PC Japanese (JP): 八丈島の基地には、回天が配備され、直接出撃する基地となったが、六軒島には配備されなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 八丈島の基地には、実際に配備され、直接出撃する基地となったが、六軒島には配備されなかった。
Russian (RU): База на острове Хачиджо была оснащена торпедами кайтен и использовалась для прямых атак, но Роккенджиму никогда ничем не снабжали.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A base de Hachijojima realmente estava equipada com aquelas armas e se tornou uma base para ataques diretos, mas Rokkenjima nunca foi abastecida com nada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然八丈島的基地曾被配備“特攻兵器”，屬於直接出擊的基地，不過，六軒島並未配備。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然八丈岛的基地曾被配备“特攻兵器”，属于直接出击的基地，不过，六轩岛并未配备。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La base sull'isola Hachijo venne equipaggiata di torpedo Kaiten e divenne una base per attacchi diretti, ma Rokkenjima non ne fu mai fornita.

Steam (ST): Furthermore, the construction was eventually suspended, and a minimum number of men were stationed on the island, waiting for orders from above that never came.
Umineko Project (UP): Not only that, they cancelled the construction work entirely, leaving only a crew of minimal size stationed on the island, waiting for orders from above that never came.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Furthermore, the construction was eventually suspended, and the minimum number of men were stationed on the island, waiting for orders from above that never came.
PC Japanese (JP): それどころか、工事を中断し、最低限の人間を残したまま、上層部は六軒島には何の命令も出さない。
Russian (RU): Более того, в итоге строительство приостановили, а на остров отправили минимум людей, ожидающих приказов сверху, которые так и не поступили.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mais do que isso, eles cancelaram completamente a obra, deixando apenas uma tripulação mínima estacionada na ilha, aguardando por ordens que nunca vieram.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 豈止如此，工程中止，留下了最低限度的人員，上面就不再對六軒島下達任何命令了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 岂止如此，工程中止，留下了最低限度的人员，上面就不再对六轩岛下达任何命令了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Inoltre, alla fine la costruzione fu sospesa, e furono posizionati sull'isola il numero minimo di uomini, che aspettavano dall'alto gli ordini che non vennero mai.

Steam (ST): Could the fact that it was a hidden base actually have sealed our fate?
Umineko Project (UP): Could it be the fact that it was a hidden base sealed our fate?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Could it be the fact that it was a hidden base sealed our fate?
PC Japanese (JP): まさか、秘密基地であったことが災いしたとでもいうのか？
Russian (RU): Неужели эта скрытая база определила нашу судьбу?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Poderia ter sido o fato de que era realmente uma base secreta, o que selou nossos destinos?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 難道是遭了“秘密基地”這個名字的殃嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 难道是遭了“秘密基地”这个名字的殃吗？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Potrebbe essere che il fatto che fosse una base segreta sigillò il nostro destino?

Steam (ST): The higher-ups had already completely forgotten about this useless and pointless cavern.
Umineko Project (UP): The higher‐ups had already completely forgotten about this useless and pointless cavern.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The higher-ups had already completely forgotten about this useless and pointless cavern.
PC Japanese (JP): 何の役にも立たない無用の岩窟は、もはや上層部にも完全に忘れ去られていたのだ。
Russian (RU): Начальство уже совсем забыло об этой бесполезной и бессмысленной пещере.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os oficiais de alto‐escalão já tinham esquecido completamente sobre aquela caverna inútil e sem sentido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 派不上任何用場的無用的岩洞，已被上面徹底地忘了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 派不上任何用场的无用的岩洞，已被上面彻底地忘了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I superiori, ormai, si erano completamente dimenticati di questa inutile e superflua caverna.

Steam (ST): We were nothing more than guards for a mere cave.
Umineko Project (UP): We were nothing more than guards for a mere cave.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We were nothing more than guards for a mere cave.
PC Japanese (JP): 私たちはただ、岩窟の番人をするだけで、何も命じられることはなかった。
Russian (RU): Мы были не более чем охранниками простой пещеры.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós não passávamos de guardas de uma simples caverna.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我們就僅僅是當著岩洞的看守，再沒有接到任何命令。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我们就仅仅是当着岩洞的看守，再没有接到任何命令。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non eravamo altro che guardie di una mera grotta.

Steam (ST): We spent our days farming, fishing, and playing with the dirt, all the while gazing up at the American formations flying past.
Umineko Project (UP): We spent our days farming, fishing, and playing with the dirt, all the while gazing up at the American formations flying past.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We spent our days farming, fishing, playing with the dirt, all the while gazing up at the American formations flying past.
PC Japanese (JP): 上空を横断する米軍の編隊を眺めながら、毎日、畑作と釣り、土いじりで過ごした。
Russian (RU): Мы проводили дни за сельским хозяйством, рыболовством и вознёй с грязью, глядя на пролетающие мимо американские формации.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Passamos nossos dias no campo, pescando e brincando com a terra, enquanto observávamos as formações americanas voando sobre nós.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 每天，邊眺望橫穿上空的美軍編隊，邊種種田，釣釣魚，翻翻土地度日。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 每天，边眺望横穿上空的美军编队，边种种田，钓钓鱼，翻翻土地度日。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Passammo i giorni coltivando, pescando, giocando con la terra, il tutto fissando le formazioni americane che volavano oltrepassandoci.

Steam (ST): ...Some of our group were relieved at the prospects of the war ending before anyone remembered we were here... and before any of us had to face a real battle.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Some of our group were relieved at the prospect of the war ending before anyone remembered we were here...and before any of us had to face a real battle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Some of our group were relieved at the prospects of the war ending before anyone remembered we were here and before any of us had to face a real battle.
PC Japanese (JP): ……ある者は、このまま自分たちは忘れ去られて、一度も実戦を経験することなく終戦を迎えられるだろうと安堵していた。
Russian (RU): ......Часть нашей группы была рада, думая, что такими темпами война закончится до того, как вспомнят, что мы здесь. До того, как нам придётся встретить настоящий бой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Alguns de nós estavam aliviados com o prospecto do fim da guerra antes que alguém lembrasse que estávamos aqui...e antes que qualquer um de nós tivesse que encarar uma batalha real.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……有的人想著“自己與大家將會就此被遺忘，不用經歷一次實戰地迎來戰爭落幕”地安下了心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……有的人想着“自己与大家将会就此被遗忘，不用经历一次实战地迎来战争落幕”地安下了心。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Qualcuno nel nostro gruppo era sollevato per il fatto che la possibilità di una guerra si concludesse prima che qualcuno si ricordasse che fossimo qui e prima che dovessimo affrontare una vera battaglia.

Steam (ST): Of course, it was the opposite for me.
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, it was the opposite for me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, it was the opposite for me.
PC Japanese (JP): 無論、私は逆だった。
Russian (RU): Естественно, для меня всё было наоборот.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, para mim, foi o oposto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當然，我可完全相反。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当然，我可完全相反。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ovviamente, per me era il contrario.

Steam (ST): I hoped and hoped for the American troops to advance and kill me as soon as possible.
Umineko Project (UP): I hoped beyond hope for the American troops to advance and kill me as soon as possible.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I hoped and hoped for the American troops to advance and kill me as soon as possible.
PC Japanese (JP): 早く米軍が押し寄せてきて、私を殺してほしいと願っていた。
Russian (RU): Я надеялся и надеялся, что американские войска вторгнутся и убьют меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu esperava além da esperança, que as tropas dos Estados Unidos avançassem e me matassem de uma vez.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在心中祈求著，希望美軍快點殺過來，把我給殺了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在心中祈求着，希望美军快点杀过来，把我给杀了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Continuavo a sperare che le truppe americane avanzassero e mi uccidessero il prima possibile.

Steam (ST): Those days were empty and blank.
Umineko Project (UP): And then, on one of those hollow days...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Those days were empty and blank.
PC Japanese (JP): そんな、虚ろな日々のことだった。
Russian (RU): Те дни были пустыми и слепыми.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E então, durante um daqueles dias vazios...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而那就發生在，這段空虛的日子裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而那就发生在，这段空虚的日子里。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quelli erano giorni vacui.

Steam (ST): Let us go back.
Umineko Project (UP): Let us go back there now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Let us go back.
PC Japanese (JP): 今こそ回想しよう。
Russian (RU): Давайте вернёмся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Vamos retornar agora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就在此刻，去回憶起來吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就在此刻，去回忆起来吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Torniamo indietro.

Steam (ST): ...Back to the turning point in my life and my fate, ...the time that Ushiromiya Kinzo finally became truly alive...
Umineko Project (UP): ......Back to the turning point in my life and my fate, ......when Ushiromiya Kinzo finally became alive......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Back to the turning point in my life and my fate......the time that Ushiromiya Kinzo finally became alive......
PC Japanese (JP): ……あの、私の人生と運命の転機と、……右代宮金蔵が真の意味で生を受ける、あの日々を……。
Russian (RU): ......Вернёмся к поворотному моменту в моей судьбе и жизни...... во времена, когда Уширомия Кинзо наконец ожил......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Voltar para o ponto de virada da minha vida e meu destino, ......quando Ushiromiya Kinzo finalmente passou a viver......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……去想起，迎來我人生與命運的轉機，……右代宮金藏得到真正意義上的生的，那段日子……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……去想起，迎来我人生与命运的转机，……右代宫金藏得到真正意义上的生的，那段日子……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Indietro, al punto di svolta della mia vita e del mio fato... al momento in cui Ushiromiya Kinzo diventò finalmente vivo...
